title: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
OB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602)Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only), the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved, but they do not have any effect. When opening a small image, such as an icon, the scrollbars are misleading because they do not perform any action.
EB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in the mentioned Build and environment, the scrollbars should be disabled and not allow any movement. When opening a small image, such as an icon, the scrollbars should be hidden to prevent misleading the user.
SR:
1. Launch Build F2 (20020602)Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only).
2. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
3. Observe the scrollbars and verify that they are enabled and can be moved.
4. Open a small image, such as an icon, and verify that the scrollbars are either hidden or disabled.
